it.dc.bridge.rd

Class RDNodeResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource
      • it.dc.bridge.rd.RDNodeResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.californium.core.server.resources.Resource

    public class RDNodeResource
extends org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource
    An RDNodeResource represents the Endpoint. It is created after a node registration and its children are the resources offer by the Endpoint. The resource is only for the purpose of the Update (POST) and Removal (DELETE), and must not implement GET or PUT methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.californium.core.server.resources.Resource

    • Method Detail

      • setParameters

        public boolean setParameters(org.eclipse.californium.core.coap.Request request)
        Updates the endpoint parameters from POST requests. The parameters that can be changed are the Endpoint lifetime lt and the Endpoint context con, the only two parameters allowed in the registration update.
        Parameters:
        request - A POST request with a {?lt,con} URI Template query and a Link Format payload.
        Returns:
        the result of the resource update function

      • addNodeResource

        public org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource addNodeResource(java.lang.String path)
        Add a new resource to the node. E.g. the resource temperature or humidity. If the path is /readings/temp, temp will be a subResource of readings, which is a subResource of the node.
        Parameters:
        path - the resource path
        Returns:
        the created resource

        Overrides:

      • handlePOST

        public void handlePOST(org.eclipse.californium.core.server.resources.CoapExchange exchange)
        The update interface is used by an endpoint to refresh or update its registration with an RD. To use the interface, the endpoint sends a POST request to the resource returned in the Location option in the response to the first registration. An update may update the lifetime or context parameters if they have changed since the last registration or update.
        Overrides:
        handlePOST in class org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource

      • handlePUT

        public void handlePUT(org.eclipse.californium.core.server.resources.CoapExchange exchange)
        Overrides:
        handlePUT in class org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource

      • handleDELETE

        public void handleDELETE(org.eclipse.californium.core.server.resources.CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the DELETE request in the given CoAPExchange. DELETEs this node resource. The response code to a DELETE request should be a Deleted (2.02).
        Overrides:
        handleDELETE in class org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource

        public java.lang.String getDomain()

      • getContext

        public java.lang.String getContext()
        Returns the Endpoint context con. This field is optional during registration. If not specified, the context is set to the source address and port.
        Returns:
        the endpoint context

      • setContext

        public void setContext(java.lang.String context)
        Sets the Endpoint context to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        context - the endpoint context

      • getLifetime

        public int getLifetime()
        Returns the Endpoint lifetime lt. This field is optional during registration. If not specified, it is set to the default value 86400.
        Returns:
        the endpoint lifetime

      • setLifeTime

        public void setLifeTime(int newLifeTime)
        Set either a new lifetime (for new resources, POST request) or update the lifetime (for PUT request).
        Parameters:
        newLifeTime - the new lifetime
